newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.
Traders said ample funds on the secondary market prevented the rates from rising, with the demand remaining stable.
"Some state-owned banks have increased their deposit volume in the central bank due to a temporary increase in income," said a local trader.
"Their trading volume made up over half of the whole volume. But on the other hand, lending by non-bank financial institutions dropped sharply," he added.
"With the falls in the interest rate subsidy, the CHIBOR is expected to fall during the rest of the year," said an analyst.
Traders expect the rates to move in narrow ranges in the next few trading days.
